intro: Hibiscus calyphyllus var. grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 15 cm in diameter, with five broad, wavy petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring sturdy stems and heart-shaped, dark green leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The flowers are typically pink to red in color and bloom during the summer months.
